result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordann J. Politoski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
First 90 days must be in jail with the second 90 days on GPS Electronic Monitoring if approved by RISK Assessment and jail administration. 
1 day credit (Only to be applied to the stayed sentence portion, not the conditional jail portion)
Huber for employment and any counseling she may be involved in.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.
Any bond posted in any of the files is to be applied to the costs.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
No contact with any of the victims in this case with the exception she write a letter of apology to the victims within the first 30 days of probation. To be given to the agent to approve and forward on.

Can receive early discharge if she has complied with and completed all conditions of her probation. 
All medications from one pharmacy. 
Sign necessary releases so agent can monitor any treatment she is undergoing and medications she is on. 
Engage in any other counseling or assessments deemed appropriate by her agent. 
Submit a DNA sample.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations unless she has had one done recently.  Then continue to comply with all treatment recommendations from that recent assessment.

timeConds.notes:
Will be allowed to serve on GPS Electronic Monitoring. 
Huber for employment and any counseling she may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date. 
(Credit cannot be applied to this conditional jail sentence).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordann J. Politoski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Certificate of Completion for Relapse Prevention Group

Defendant Jordann J. Politoski in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CM216, 15CM294, 15CM295, 15CM408

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM216 Counts 1, 2 & 6 - GUILTY
15CM294 - GUILTY
15CM295 Count 1 - GUILTY 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CM216 Counts 1, 2 & 6, 15CM294, 15CM295 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed and read-in are the following: 
15CM216 Counts 3, 4 & 5
15CM295 Counts 2 & 3
15CM408 in its entirety

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Schmidt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CM216 Count 1 - 
6 months jail STAYED
First 90 days must be in jail with the second 90 days on GPS Electronic monitoring if approved by RISK Assessment and jail administration.
1 day credit (only to be applied to the stayed sentence portion, not the conditional jail portion)
Huber for employment and any counseling she may be involved in. 

Placed on probation for a period of 24 months: 
Can receive early discharge if she has complied with and completed all conditions of her probation. 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. unless she has had one done recently.   Continue to comply with all treatment recommendations from that recent assessment. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All medications from one pharmacy.
Sign necessary releases so agent can monitor any treatment she is undergoing and medications she is on. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Continue to work fulltime. 
Engage in any other counseling or assessments deemed appropriate by her agent. 
Submit a DNA sample. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Serve 30 days jail.  
Will be allowed to serve on GPS Electronic Monitoring.
Huber for employment and any counseling she may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date. 
No contact with any of the victims in this case with the exception she write letter of apology to the victims within first 30 days of probation.  To be given to the agent to approve and forward on. 

15CM216 Count 2 
6 months jail STAYED, concurrent with Count 1
First 90 days must be in jail with the second 90 days on GPS Electronic monitoring if approved by RISK Assessment and jail administration.
Huber for employment and any counseling she may be involved in. 
Placed on probation for 24 months concurrent, 
Can receive early discharge if she has complied with and completed all conditions of her probation. 
Comply with all conditions set forth in Count 1. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
 
15CM216 Count 6 
6 months jail STAYED, concurrent with Counts 1 & 2
First 90 days must be in jail with the second 90 days on GPS Electronic monitoring if approved by RISK Assessment and jail administration.
Huber for employment and any counseling she may be involved in. 
Placed on probation for 24 months concurrent, 
Can receive early discharge if she has complied with and completed all conditions of her probation. 
Comply with all conditions set forth in Count 1. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

15CM294 - 
30 days jail STAYED consecutive to 15CM216. 
Can be served on electronic monitoring if approved by the RISK assessment and jail administration
Huber for employment and any counseling she may be invovled in. 
Placed on probation for 24 months, concurrent: 
Can receive early discharge if she has complied with and completed all conditions of her probation. 
Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CM216 Count 1. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

15CM295 Count 1 - 
60 days jail consecutive to any other sentence. STAYED
Can be served on electronic monitoring if approved by the RISK assessment and jail administration.
Huber for employment and any counseling she may be invovled in. 
Placed on probation for 24 months, concurrent: 
Can receive early discharge if she has complied with and completed all conditions of her probation, at discretion of the agent. 
Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CM216 Count 1. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

Any bonds posted in all the files are to be applied to the costs/surcharges in all files.

1:16 p.m.  Court calls case.
ADA Knasapen appears in Court.  
Defendant (d.o.b: 12-20-1995) appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Battery and Disorderly Conduct. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a signature bond of $5,000.00  with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  May 26, 2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3.
